Package command

Class ExecutionCommand

java.lang.Object
command.ExecutionCommand
public class ExecutionCommand
extends java.lang.Object
A class that holds all the information about the execution by a block (currently executed) that is not an actionBlock. This information consists of the objects previouslyExecuted, currentlyExecuted and nextToExecute. The class also specifies what must happen to undo and execute this command.
Version:
4.0
Author:
Andreas Awouters Thomas Van Erum Dirk Vanbeveren Geert Wesemael

  • Constructor Details

    • ExecutionCommand

      public ExecutionCommand​(Block previouslyExecuted, Block currentlyExecuted, Block nextToExecute, GameController GC)
      ExecutionCommand is a command that is able to hold all of the information to undo and redo the execution of this command.
      Parameters:
      previouslyExecuted - The block that was executed before this one.
      currentlyExecuted - The block that is executed now.
      nextToExecute - The next block that will be executed.
      GC - The GameController that includes the blocks.

  • Method Details

    • undo

      public void undo()
      This function can be used to undo an execution command.

    • execute

      public void execute()
      This function can be used to execute this command.

    • setPrevious

      public void setPrevious​(Block block)
      Set the previously executed block of this object.
      Parameters:
      block - The block that is executed before this command.

    • setCurrent

      public void setCurrent​(Block block)
      Set the currently executing block of this object.
      Parameters:
      block - The block that is executed in this command.

    • setNext

      public void setNext​(Block block)
      Set the 'next to execute' block of this object.
      Parameters:
      block - The block that should be executed after this command.

    • setSnapshot

      public void setSnapshot​(game_world.api.Snapshot snapshot)
      Set the snapshot.
      Parameters:
      snapshot - The snapshot to be saved.
